newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish PM in hospital for heart treatment.
newsitem.headline: Finnish PM in hospital for heart treatment.

text.p: Finnish Prime Minister Paavo Lipponen had hospital treatment in Copenhagen on Tuesday for a heart rhythm problem, Finland's government said.
An official statement said he was later released by doctors in the Danish capital.

"Prime Minister Paavo Lipponen was being treated today at the Copenhagen central hospital due to a heart rhythm disturbance. (He) was released from hospital in the afternoon to return home and he will be back at work on Wednesday," the government said.
Lipponen was in Denmark to attend a meeting of the Nordic Council in Copenhagen.
An official at the prime minister's office said Lipponen was scheduled to return to Helsinki on a flight due at 1835 local time (1635 GMT).
